programme.title: WW2 Treasure Hunters
programme.desc: Madness frontman Suggs and militaria expert Stephen Taylor tell the stories behind artefacts unearthed from former military sites across the UK. They also discover a tank buried in a vineyard.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Hurricane Florence brings biblical flooding to North Carolina, a magnitude 7 earthquake rocks Alaska, and a surfer crashes in Nazare’s colossal waves.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: A look at how a three-man crew on DHL A300 battled against the plane's failing hydraulics as a routine mail flight turned into a fight for their lives.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth plots to empty the overflowing warehouse behind Les's back, but risks upsetting his father.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth goes against Les's advice and buys an old Chevy sign at Detroit's annual Woodward Dream Cruise event and hopes that he has made the right decision.

programme.title: Outback Truckers
programme.desc: Truck driving fiancés Ash Bryant and Darryl Armfield are on a time critical job shifting 200 cattle over 500 kilometres of bush roads – but have they driven straight into trouble?.

programme.title: Ice Road Truckers
programme.desc: The drivers for trucking companies VP Express and Polar Industries are put to the test when the winter presents an even bigger adversary - the Polar Vortex, bringing with it the worst winter conditions in a century. With the storm due, Lisa Kelly and Darrell Ward return to lead team Polar to victory, while Art Burke and Todd Dewey set out to prove that they too can beat the conditions by making a delivery.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Star Trek actor William Shatner presents Mike and Frank with a list of rare items he wants them to track down for his house.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Rob Beckett, Jen Brister, Darren Harriott
programme.desc: Stand-up comedian Rob Beckett plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He warms up the audience and then introduces routines by rising comedy stars Jen Brister and Darren Harriott.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of guests Tom Allen, Ed Gamble, Milton Jones, Zoe Lyons and Geoff Norcott. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Lorraine Kelly and Dara O Briain join David Mitchell's team while Barry Cryer and Sue Perkins are captained by Lee Mack, on the panel game where contestants try to fool their opponents into mistaking fact for fiction and vice versa. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: The crew stumbles upon the mysteriously abandoned SS Trojan, and while the group inspects the ship, Rimmer receives a distress call from his brother. Starring Craig Charles, Danny John-Jules, Chris Barrie and Robert Llewellyn.

programme.title: Red Dwarf
programme.desc: Searching for some tech to fix Starbug's faulty steering, Lister and his crew dock at a research station where scientists claim to have manufactured a 'cure' for evil. Sci-fi comedy, starring Craig Charles, Danny-John Jules and Chris Barrie.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Topical comedy quiz show, hosted by Dara O Briain. Regular panellist Hugh Dennis looks back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of guests Tom Allen, Ed Gamble, Milton Jones, Zoe Lyons and Geoff Norcott. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.

programme.title: The Indestructibles
programme.desc: Athletes take on daring stunts, with often hilarious results! Inspired by the sport of wakeboarding, Tim and Gendle invent a life-sized game of stone skipping.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: History Hunters
programme.desc: A former dealer is selling his entire medal collection - will Dave and Steve find anything worth bidding for? And Steve digs deep into a WW1 army medic's family history.

programme.title: Warbird Workshop
programme.desc: At St Athan in Wales, engineer John Sparks and his team of ex-Navy and RAF engineers begin the task of reassembling the Czech-built jet from nine parts delivered by lorry.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong build a wooden boat, following original designs for the vessels used during the Gold Rush. This vessel must carry them across hundreds of miles of treacherous lakes and rivers, including the infamous One Mile Rapids, a narrow canyon of white water and jagged rocks.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: The historian follows in the footsteps of 19th-century gold prospectors, attempting to find riches in a remote region on the edge of the Canadian arctic. He is joined on his expedition by polar explorer Felicity Aston and physiologist Dr Kevin Fong. The first challenge of the trek is to cross Alaska's Coast Mountains, where they retrace two routes set by 19th-century miners and brave icy rivers, avalanche-prone slopes and near vertical ascents.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Operation Gold Rush with Dan Snow
programme.desc: Dan Snow, Felicity Aston and Dr Kevin Fong finally arrive at the end of their gruelling journey in Dawson City. They set up a traditional mining camp in the heart of the gold fields, before facing their next challenge. They have just five days to find gold in an area that has already been heavily mined, and can only use the back-breaking methods of the 19th-century early pioneers.

programme.title: Prince Philip: The Plot to Make a King
programme.desc: Secret History documentary telling the inside story of the dynastic tensions that were unleashed when Princess Elizabeth, the future queen, fell in love with Prince Philip. It was felt that Philip was rough and ill-mannered - and with the Second World War still fresh in most people's minds, the royal and political elite disliked his German roots. But following the death of King George VI in 1952, the establishment feared a dynastic coup, with the Queen torn between the two sides. The documentary examines the complexities and frustrations of the royal marriage, as the monarch struggled to reconcile the love of her husband with the suspicions of her family and her government.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story of America's ‘Liberty Ships', which were produced in incredible numbers and became known as the Model T Fords of the ocean.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The remarkable story of how Stalin's massive war factories were dismantled and moved east on one and half million railway trucks, to avoid being lost to the Nazis.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wildlife that inhabit remote islands, revealing the advantages and disadvantages of the creatures' habitat. Three-toed sloths in the Caribbean and nesting albatross enjoy a peaceful existence untroubled by predators, but other animals are not so fortunate. Marine iguanas in the Galapagos Islands are preyed on by racer snakes from birth, while penguins on the Antarctic island of Zavodovski risk being battered against the rocks by fierce waves.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Rare footage of the elusive animals that live in the unforgiving environment of the world's mountain ranges. A female snow leopard with a cub ends up caught between two rival males, grizzly bears rub themselves up against trees in an attempt to shed their winter fur, and golden eagles hunt over snow-capped peaks.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of plants and animals that live in jungles, one of the hardest environments to thrive in, including strange fungi and creatures that glow in the dark which have never been captured on film before. The programme also includes recordings of caimans and the jaguars that prey on them, freshwater dolphins that swim through flooded forests, undergrowth-dwelling frogs that have to defend themselves against wasps, and the Indri, the world's largest living lemur, which inhabits the forests of Madagascar.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of animals that live in the desert, including a pride of desert lions that risks hunting a giraffe several times their size. The film also features an immense swarm of locusts, sand grouse flying for 120 miles to gather water for their offspring, and an unprecedented recording of a tiny bat defending itself against one of the world's deadliest scorpions.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Wildlife that inhabit the world's grasslands, areas that are struck by some of the most dramatic seasonal changes seen in the world. The programme features footage of Brazil's giant anteaters and Asian saiga antelope, as well as lions engaging in ferocious battles with buffalo in the flooded Okavango, bee-eaters taking advantage of elephants to help them catch insects, and caribou embarking on migrations across the freezing northern tundra, stalked every step of the way by predatory Arctic wolves.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wild animals that have made a home in cities, including leopards on the streets of Mumbai, peregrine falcons hunting among New York's skyscrapers, hyenas that live peacefully alongside the people of Harar, macaques in Jaipur, and langurs in Jodhpur, which are regarded as having great religious significance by the citizens. The programme also examines how some animals are struggling to survive in urban environments, and questions how cities can be built to serve their needs as well as those of the human inhabitants.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of wildlife that inhabit remote islands, revealing the advantages and disadvantages of the creatures' habitat. Three-toed sloths in the Caribbean and nesting albatross enjoy a peaceful existence untroubled by predators, but other animals are not so fortunate. Marine iguanas in the Galapagos Islands are preyed on by racer snakes from birth, while penguins on the Antarctic island of Zavodovski risk being battered against the rocks by fierce waves.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Rare footage of the elusive animals that live in the unforgiving environment of the world's mountain ranges. A female snow leopard with a cub ends up caught between two rival males, grizzly bears rub themselves up against trees in an attempt to shed their winter fur, and golden eagles hunt over snow-capped peaks.

programme.title: Planet Earth II
programme.desc: Footage of plants and animals that live in jungles, one of the hardest environments to thrive in, including strange fungi and creatures that glow in the dark which have never been captured on film before. The programme also includes recordings of caimans and the jaguars that prey on them, freshwater dolphins that swim through flooded forests, undergrowth-dwelling frogs that have to defend themselves against wasps, and the Indri, the world's largest living lemur, which inhabits the forests of Madagascar.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A marooned ironclad structure off the coast of England that hides a dramatic story of war and resilience, and a facility in the heart of America that helped tear apart a nation.

programme.title: Train Truckers
programme.desc: Heavy haulage experts Ian Bagladi and Jamie Turnbull need to move a classical but abandoned 63-year-old, 70-tonne locomotive, through the English countryside.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Four VW camper vans pitch up at the auction house looking for a new home and Derek picks up an Austin 16 that 'goes like stink and has some unusual modern modifications'.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Mathewsons agree to sell a vintage threshing machine and large collection of tractors, but extracting them from old barns on a Yorkshire farm proves a bigger job than anticipated.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Nurse Gladys Emmanuel's washing-machine breaks down, and Arkwright decides to try and lure her into his home with the offer of his vintage machine.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville struggles to find some privacy when the milkwoman makes a pass at him. Nurse Gladys Emmanuel steps in by persuading Arkwright to take her to a hotel.

programme.title: Lady Chatterley
programme.desc: Connie's marriage begins to fall apart, so she flees to her father's seaside retreat. But before she leaves, she must fulfil her promise to Mellors of one last night together. Starring Joely Richardson and Sean Bean.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: As a third victim is found murdered, Marilyn soon identifies the man responsible as Damon Morton (Iain Glen), and Walker must gather evidence to secure his conviction.

programme.title: Garden Hopping
programme.desc: Daphne Ledward visits the Headland Garden in Polruan, Cornwall - one of the participants opening its havens to the public in the National Gardens Scheme - where plants face the harsh conditions of salt air and high winds.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The CO has a lot on his mind after a civilian gets caught in the crossfire during a training exercise, causing an embittered Mark to fly off the handle. Julie has a surprise for Tony and Jacko, but ends up learning a harsh lesson, while Karen's son Kevin wonders if he might be gay.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: Fitzpatrick's domestic life is thrown into turmoil by a stunning revelation from Jacko, and Andy ends up bearing the brunt of Mark's traumatic experiences of civilian life.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part three of three. Adam tries to defuse the threat of strike action by the relief, reminding them of their duties as police officers and offering to let Yvonne return to the station while the inquiry takes its course. Dan reacts with dismay when Rochelle suggests they put their affair on hold, Gary chafes under Suzie's condescending attitude, and Samantha looks on in disbelief as the simmering hostility between brothers Phil and Steve erupts into violence.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: A woman comes in for a heart transplant, and Connie persuades her to accept an experimental procedure that has never been tried before. Ric leaves Nick in charge while he is at the university, but Jac does not approve of his handling of a cancer patient's treatment and a past conflict between them resurfaces.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Josh regrets a moment of kindness toward an unprofessional colleague caught moonlighting as a taxi driver to earn some extra cash, and Sunny faces the music at his disciplinary hearing. Hospital chaplain Peter offers spiritual support to Eve, then stares tragedy in the face himself. Derek Thompson and Ian Bleasdale star.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.sub-title: One Step Too Far - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Laura looks at Gabriel with new eyes when he takes a surprisingly compassionate approach to her wayward son Liam, who is being bullied because of her job. Adam tries to mend fences with the rank-and-file officers by going out on the beat with June - only to lose his cool completely when a traffic accident triggers painful memories. Samantha jeopardises Jo's investigation by poaching her informant, leading to a bitter row, while Gary's future on the force looks uncertain after he reacts to Suzie's constant needling with a very public outburst.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Grant meets up with an old mate from the army. Hattie and Steve are bickering and Clyde would like Gidea to stay with him in Walford.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon is reluctant to tell Phil that her relationship with Grant is back on.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: Nick travels to Cyprus in an effort to locate Ariadne and bring her home, but things do not turn out as planned. Meanwhile, Sally visits her sick father.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Camille's best friend, a singer on a Caribbean party boat, collapses on stage during a night of music and cocktails. After she dies in the policewoman's arms, the officers question the vessel's staff and on-board tourists in an effort to get to the bottom of her mysterious demise. Photographs taken on the evening offer a fuller picture of what took place, but could the answer lie in the vocalist's pre-show routine? Meanwhile, DI Poole tries his best to comfort a grieving Camille, but it soon becomes clear that sensitivity is not his strong suit. Ben Miller and Sara Martins star, with guest appearances from singer Jamelia, Dexter Fletcher (Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels) and Amanda Mealing (ex-Holby City).

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: An English tourist is strangled in her villa by a killer using the victim's scarf. The crime scene indicates a robbery gone wrong, but DI Poole recalls an almost identical case back in London. He grows even more suspicious when the victim's husband turns out to be crooked former colleague Doug Anderson, a name he had hoped was consigned to the past. But even though he has a watertight alibi and the team move on to further leads, Poole can't shake the notion that his old adversary is somehow involved. Ben Miller stars, with guest appearances from Neil Pearson, Ralf Little and Miller's former Primeval co-stars Hannah Spearritt and James Murray.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo is invited to lay a wreath at Dunkirk for the millennium - but gets into trouble due to his dress sense. Christmas special from 1999, starring Bill Owen in the last performance he filmed before his death.

credits.actor: Bill Owen in the last performance he filmed before his death

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Who's That Dancing with Nora Batty, Then?
programme.desc: Clegg, Compo and Blamire look for a piano to provide the entertainment at Gloria's surprise farewell party before she emigrates to Australia. Meanwhile, two new librarians arrive and are bent on keeping the morality of the facility in tact.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: The islanders batten down the hatches as a hurricane approaches Saint Marie - but the police can't take cover as they're called to another murder, this time at the local university. The victim is a meteorologist, whose death has been staged to look like an accident - and the plot thickens when it emerges he had something important to tell the dean but died before he got the chance. To confuse matters, all his colleagues seem to have a reason for wanting him dead. Can the team unmask the culprit before the storm hits? Ben Miller and Sara Martins star, with Gavin & Stacey actor Mathew Horne.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: When a shot is fired at a charity fundraiser, host Malcolm Powell is found dead in his study. The victim's PA is certain she knows who the culprit is - a mystery man named Jack Roberts who had an appointment with her boss and was seen fleeing from the scene of the crime. Richard and his team find the suspect's abandoned car nearby with no clues as to his whereabouts or motive for the killing. However, a background check on the dead man reveals that he and his wife defrauded investors out of millions of pounds back in England. Guest starring Sean Pertwee, Lucy Davis and Julie Graham.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The former leader of an Irish Republican group comes forward with information regarding the abduction and subsequent disappearance of an 18-year-old woman in 1983, prompting the team to reopen the case. The reformed dissident claims the rebels used the kidnapping to raise their profile, but his subsequent reinvention as a politician and man of peace leaves Sandra and her colleagues suspicious of his motives. They also investigate whether the arms-manufacturing activities of the victim's father could have made her a target. Crime drama, guest starring Sian Phillips and Annette Crosbie, with Amanda Redman and James Bolam.

programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: St Davids - Britain's Smallest City
programme.desc: Forager Julia scours the shoreline for seaweed for her sustainable soaps, the bug farm hosts its summer fair and the residents of Britain's smallest city celebrate the end of the busy summer season at farmer Gerald's harvest party.

programme.title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
programme.sub-title: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire? Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Singer and presenter Charlotte Church, Pointless co-host Richard Osman and footballer-turned-pundit John Barnes take their turns at answering the 15 questions that could bag them £1million for their chosen charities. As always, if they get stuck, they have four lifelines to fall back on - Ask the Audience, 50/50, Phone a Friend and Ask the Host. Jeremy Clarkson asks the questions.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Chris Tarrant chats about new ITV1 drama Quiz, in which he is played Michael Sheen.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: The GMB team is joined by Lorraine Kelly for the final hour, with the latest on the coronavirus pandemic, as well as other stories.

programme.title: This Morning
programme.desc: A mix of celebrity chat, lifestyle features, advice and competitions.

programme.title: Loose Women
programme.desc: Celebrity interviews and studio discussion from a female perspective.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: The chef is joined by Paul Ainsworth to explore the culinary delights of Dorset, with the pair going aboard a millionaire's yacht, where James cooks a sea bass dish. Paul samples local cheeses, while James visits a breeder with Mangalitsa pigs in a beautiful coastline setting.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.sub-title: On Her Majesty's National Health Service
programme.desc: A team of colleagues answer questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as four contestants pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: In this edition, Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show from Bognor Regis, setting members of the public unusual challenges for a chance to win anything from the price of their petrol to £1,000 in the big finale game.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Long-running soap following the ups and downs of village life amid the rolling scenery of the Yorkshire Dales.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Long-running drama with the residents of England's most famous cobbled street.

programme.title: Coronavirus: Q&A
programme.desc: Nina Hossein puts viewers' questions on a range of subjects relating to the Covid-19 outbreak to a panel of expert guests.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and the team head to the Yorkshire Dales to surprise Jim Thompson, a terminally ill 65-year-old grandfather and fundraiser. Despite Jim's own diagnosis, his commitment to spreading awareness and raising money for prostate cancer charities are legendary in the area, including creating a Calendar Girls-style naked calendar. Inspired by his bravery and dedication, the makeover team decide to turn Jim's overgrown and dangerous plot into a classic cottage garden with a Yorkshire twist.

programme.title: Quiz
programme.desc: Major Charles Ingram doesn't like quizzes, but for his wife Diana and brother-in-law Adrian knowing the answer is a way of life. As Diana and Adrian's repeated attempts to get into the hotseat on Who Wants to Be a Millionare? fall short, all eyes turn to an unsuspecting Charles to win the million-pound prize. Meanwhile, the repeated reappearance of middle-class, professional quizzers has not gone unnoticed by the ITV team and producer Paul Smith makes a vow to stop them by any means necessary. Fact-based drama directed by Stephen Frears, starring Matthew Macfadyen, Sian Clifford and Mark Bonnar, with Michael Sheen as Chris Tarrant.

programme.title: ITV News at Ten
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents.

programme.title: Gordon, Gino and Fred: American Road Trip
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay aims to show his companions that US food lives up to its reputation of being bigger and better as they travel from Nevada to Los Angeles. They begin in style with a helicopter ride about the Grand Canyon - although Gino is too nervous to appreciate the spectacle below him. Next up is a trout fishing trip contest in the Colorado River, followed by a burger in Las Vegas with a hefty price tag of $777 and a visit to a ranch where they have to round up herds of cattle on horseback. Finally, they hit Los Angeles, where they have a barbecue battle.

programme.title: Kate & Koji
programme.desc: When word reaches that a storm is headed for town, Kate refuses to step in line, much to the grief of Councillor Bone. Koji discovers he has been given a jacket with an unfortunate history, and Medium may have lost Kate a lot of money on the horses. Comedy, starring Brenda Blethyn and Jimmy Akingbola.

programme.title: Quiz
programme.desc: Major Charles Ingram doesn't like quizzes, but for his wife Diana and brother-in-law Adrian knowing the answer is a way of life. As Diana and Adrian's repeated attempts to get into the hotseat on Who Wants to Be a Millionare? fall short, all eyes turn to an unsuspecting Charles to win the million-pound prize. Meanwhile, the repeated reappearance of middle-class, professional quizzers has not gone unnoticed by the ITV team and producer Paul Smith makes a vow to stop them by any means necessary. Fact-based drama directed by Stephen Frears, starring Matthew Macfadyen, Sian Clifford and Mark Bonnar, with Michael Sheen as Chris Tarrant.

programme.desc: Exclusive non-stop mix of the hottest tracks to soundtrack your life!.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: After finding evidence of a 1700s-era lifeboat near shore, Darrell and the team discover the shipwreck it came from, but a sudden tragedy hits the expedition.

programme.title: Top 10 Mysteries and Conspiracies
programme.desc: The enigmatic events and unexplained phenomena that have piqued curiosity throughout history, culminating in the number one mystery and conspiracy of all time.

programme.title: What On Earth?
programme.desc: Satellites discover what appears to be US stealth technology deep inside China, and an unidentified cloud swamps America's skies.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: The team works on the first-ever diesel-powered chopper, Paul Jr attends the opening of the dog park he has designed, and Mikey performs his stand-up routine to a packed house.

programme.title: Airplane Repo
programme.desc: Kevin has grabbed himself a Learjet, but when a mechanical failure leads to an imbalance in the plane's fuel load, he must descend through a building storm.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe becomes a bone-black technician, refining a black pigment from charred cow bones, and two viewers get a chance to select their favourite moments from the series.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: An insight into the creation of gingerbread houses, livestock trailers, bottom-rolling hangar doors and toy figurines.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Traffic Signal Poles/Coffee Filters/Chainsaw Mining Machines
programme.desc: The planning, design and manufacturing processed behind the creation of traffic signal poles, coffee filters and chainsaw mining machines.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: While Frank Fritz is on the mend. Mike Wolfe and his brother Robbie crisscross Colorado and find a giant cow-shaped RV.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Robbie uncover a hidden stash of awesome motorcycle relics at a Colorado property littered with massive man-mobiles.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: A junkyard wizard has an Oktoberfest gem with Frank Fritz's name written all over it.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: With a jam-packed farmhouse, killer barn, and rare rat rod Rolls Royce, Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz find a massive Ohio collection has mega-pick potential.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit a hot rod mechanic with a super expensive collection of rare bubbletop cars.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz meet Larry, who has the ultimate big boy toys including a rare Porsche and a pair of unusual pick-ups that really xreate some interest.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Skilled 'pickers' Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz are excited to receive an invite to meet a former racer and adrenaline junkie in his vintage Ohio garage.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz unleash a sleek '67 Jaguar in a New Jersey garage and later pick a general store with a Presidential past.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Danielle join an architectural salvage crew on a special mission, while Robbie and Frank hunt for treasure in an old theatre-turned-prop warehouse.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz head to Minnesota on a rescue mission to help save the remains of a carnival business from Mother Nature.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: In the middle of a Minnesota blizzard Mike and Frank face the frost to uncover a rare pair of trucks on farmer Jim's spread. Series following the lives of Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz, two of America's most skilled 'pickers', who travel around the country trawling junk yards, garages, attics and barns for precious objects.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers save a quirky counter, a 100-piece chandelier and a vintage football table. Plus, a 100-year-old shop counter is rescued from a bonfire.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Mechanic Edd China teams up with Mike Brewer to get a classic Saab 900 Turbo back on the road.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China face the challenge of working to a tight budget as they continue with the Saab 900 Turbo restoration.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and his long-time friend Tee John set out on a tour of France. In Normandy, Drew falls in love with a grand chateau and in a massive antique fair immerses himself in pop culture.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads for a country pile that's stuffed with antiques. He also drops in on a dapper dealer whose shop turns out to be as stylish as its owner.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The Bushmen confront a miner who has illegally dug their claim. The Young Guns must find a new source of opal when poisonous fumes force them to abandon their mine.

programme.title: Deadliest Catch
programme.desc: The fleet face a second major storm, while rookie skipper Jake Anderson reaches out to Sig Hansen for help and Josh Harris arrives on the grounds weeks late.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The technology used to communicate with spacecraft in orbit and ensure the world's biggest ships stay seaworthy. Plus, how limousines are lengthened to ensure a smooth ride.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: Providing services at one of the world's largest casino hotels, and constructing a golf course in the desert.

programme.title: The World's Fattest Man - A Love Story
programme.desc: The former 'World's Fattest Man' Paul Mason seeks a surgeon to remove the excess skin after his 700lbs weight loss. As he struggles through his weight-loss journey, he finds love.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Photographic evidence captured by forensic experts who are the first to the scene of a crime.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The death of 16-year-old Skylar Neese, whose remains were found in January 2013, six months after she was reported missing from her West Virginia home. Rachel Shoaf pleaded guilty to second-degree murder, telling authorities that she and fellow teenager, Shelia Eddy, planned and carried out Neese's murder.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of Erica Vassell, who disappeared after a party in Clewiston, Florida. When her brutally murdered body was found days later, friends were left in shock and fear.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The Behavioural Science Unit is asked to profile suspects when the naked bodies of several women are discovered.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: The team tries to rescue more than 100 animals, including 50 dogs, from some of the worst living conditions its members have witnessed.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown is visited by Mr Wilson the shar-pei puppy, Martha the alligator, Cheeky the bird and Polar the samoyed - a snow coloured Siberian dog.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Sarah vows to turn Virgina's appointment around when they realise the dress of her dreams has been sold. Meanwhile, Kelly's dress must be taken apart seam by seam.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A bride is torn between her own vision and that of her family, while another shares her bittersweet appointment with her terminally ill father.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Chassidy is looking for her dream dress - the problem is, so is her scene-stealing mother. Can Mum put her own agenda aside long enough to give Chassidy her day?.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Untraditional bride Maranda is looking for the perfect 'out-of-the-box' magical fairy-tale dress for when she meets her husband for the first time - at the wedding.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.sub-title: Mamas and Dramas and Tears, Oh My!
programme.desc: Lori and her team encounter some of their biggest conflicts yet, including a Nascar bride in distress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: The team helps a bride who has tried on 150 dresses, another who already owns two wedding gowns, and one who sets the record for the longest appointment yet.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Lori reaches her limit with the most disrespectful bridesmaids she has ever met, including some who try to put the bride off her dream dress.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown deals with Fergus, the accident-prone dog, and Brian, the bulldog who is struggling to breathe. Tim attempts to tackle some runaway sheep.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: It's a first for Dr Chris Brown as he tests his skills against fast-moving turtles. A hungry pup is in danger of hurting itself after starting to eat things that it shouldn't.

programme.title: American Monster
programme.desc: The crimes of Audrey Frazier, who fatally poisoned her husband Frank Hilley in 1975 and attempted to kill her daughter in June 1983.

programme.title: American Monster
programme.desc: The death of Charlie Billis in a car crash in 2009. The driver, his wife Chrissy, deliberately ran the vehicle into a tree after noting he had failed to fasten his seat belt, and later tried to unburden herself of her guilt after registering with an online dating service.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The murder of retailer Harvey Fuson in January 2011. The 66-year-old was well-loved by members of his local community and the manner of his death shocked the Tennessee town of Cumberland Gap as well as the entire Tri-State area.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 25-year-old waitress Zilpha Lowery who vanished in July 1993. Foul play was immediately suspected as rumours of Lowery's fate spread through her North Carolina town and tied her to another mysterious disappearance. Her body was found with its skull crushed several months later, but it would be another 13 years before a tip led detectives out of state to find their man.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: At 605lbs, Tracey carries most of her body weight in her misshapen legs - which are so extreme she needs someone to lift them out of bed. She turns to medic Dr Nowzaradan for help in losing weight.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.sub-title: Steven and Justin's Story - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Steven weighs 800lbs and his brother Justin 600lbs. Desperate to save both his sons' lives, their father travels across the US to seek help.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.sub-title: Steven and Justin's Story - Part Two
programme.desc: Part two of two. After a year on a weight loss programme, Steven is non-compliant, and Justin focuses on a new career instead of his diet.

programme.title: French Collection
programme.desc: Ray sees potential in a French dresser when the search for valuables heads to Carpentras, southern France, while Ben surprises Mark when he manages to sell on an antique typewriter. Meanwhile, Joanne gets to work reupholstering dining chairs in the hope of turning a good profit.

programme.title: Posh Pawn
programme.desc: The high-end clients and luxury items continue to roll in, including a celebrity hat designer looking to sell her spectacular diamond-encrusted ruby necklace to raise funds to open a boutique. Paintings by East End gangsters the Kray twins cause a dilemma for the team, and MD James Constantinou tries out a water jet pack. Plus, fake watches lead to a bust-up among staff amid preparations for the grand opening of the flagship store.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Part one of two. Betti Jo is seven months pregnant and facing potential paralysis due to complications. On track to her goal weight, Susan worries about compromising her diet.

programme.title: Sister Wives
programme.sub-title: First a Verdict, Then a Lawyer
programme.desc: The Browns worry about whether the anthropology students will think they are a healthy family or a dysfunctional one.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Clare returns for her fitting five-stone lighter, while Jo and Al try to help Melissa, who has already tried on 60 dresses.

programme.title: Curvy Brides Boutique
programme.desc: Fussy bride Eve is yet to find her dress but the appointment gets off to a terrible start. Plus, Gemma is worried her dress won't fit at her final fitting.

programme.title: Faking It: Tears of a Crime
programme.desc: Recalling the events of 2008 when nine-year-old Shannon Matthews was reported missing from her home in Dewsbury, West Yorkshire. Her mother Karen made numerous emotional television appeals, but experts analysed the evidence to pinpoint tell-tale signs of a cover-up by the parent, who eventually confessed that she had known the child's whereabouts all along.
